client_profile: Couple seeking to buy an apartment in Brussels, budget 605000–1120000 EUR. Priorities include cafes, restaurants, culture, and museums.
red_flags: Potential budget stretch in popular areas
contradictions: Preference for vibrant areas vs. noise levels
questions_for_agent_landlord: What are the average monthly costs including utilities?
How long has the property been on the market?
Are there any upcoming developments in the area?
What is the community like during weekdays?
Is there a history of complaints regarding noise or safety?

top_districts.name: City of Brussels
budget_reality: Rule of thumb: Prices in City of Brussels can exceed budget for prime locations.
How to validate: Monitor listings regularly for realistic apartment pricing.

microhoods.name: Haren
microhoods.why: Haren features parks and good transit connections to the city.
microhoods.watch_out: Some areas have potential noise from trains nearby.

microhoods.name: Bois de la Cambre
microhoods.why: Offers green spaces alongside access to cafes and shops.
microhoods.watch_out: Traffic can increase during weekends due to park visitors.

why: Central location with parks like Royal Park nearby.
Active cafe and restaurant scene contributing to social life.
watch_out: Touristy pockets and traffic can feel noisy on weekends.

top_districts.name: Ixelles
budget_reality: Rule of thumb: Ixelles generally maintains higher price points than surrounding areas.
How to validate: Assess average home prices in local listings.

microhoods.name: Boondael
microhoods.why: Offers a vibrant community with green spaces.

why: Diverse community with rich cultural offerings.
Many cafes and restaurants contributing to lively atmosphere.
watch_out: Popular spots can lead to noise and traffic.
